['**Plot** - The sequence of events in a story.', '**Dialogue** - The spoken words of the characters in a story.', '**Setting** - The time and place in which a story takes place.', '**Theme** - The central idea or message of a story.', '**Characters** - The people (or animals) who take part in the story.', '**Genre** - A category of literature based on style or content.', '**Narrative** - The story told by the author.', '**Inspiration** - The source of an idea for a story.', '**Imagination** - The ability to create new ideas or things in the mind.', '**Wordplay** - The use of language in a playful or creative way.', '**Suspense** - A feeling of anticipation or anxiety about what will happen next.', '**Emotional** - Relating to the feelings or experiences of the characters.', '**Metaphor** - A comparison between two unlike things that suggests they have something in common.', '**Symbolism** - The use of an object or action to represent something else.', '**Resolution** - The part of the story where the main conflict is resolved.', '**Plot twist** - A sudden change in the story that changes the outcome.']
